keywords.value: Automating Inequality: How High-Tech Tools Profile, Police, and Punish the Poor (Book)

docs.snippet: The National Academy of Social Insurance writes that the country has made no progress in reducing disparities in income and wealth.
The Facebook co-founder’s rise was meteoric. He argues that the same forces that helped him succeed have made it harder for others. In a new book, “Fair Shot,” he proposes a bold solution.

headline.print_headline: Inequality: A Secret  To His Success

docs.snippet: Long plagued by poverty and desperation, Stockton, Calif., is testing universal basic income as a means of improving the lives of its residents.

headline.main: Free Cash to Fight Income Inequality? California City Is First in U.S. to Try
headline.print_headline: A City as a Basic-Income Test Lab

docs.snippet: Women hold nearly two-thirds of student loan debt, and black women graduate with the most debt of any group.

A U.N.-supported human rights expert has blasted the yawning gap between rich and poor in the United States, insisting in a new report that the world's richest country "is now moving full steam ahead to make itself even more unequal."

headline.main: UN Expert Calls US Income Inequality 'a Political Choice'
headline.print_headline: UN Expert Calls US Income Inequality 'a Political Choice'

docs.snippet: Spain's new Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez said on Monday the European Union should be a space of economic and social cohesion and that inequalities within the bloc must be reduced.

headline.main: EU Needs to Fight Inequalities, New Spanish PM Says
